0.title: The Shawshank Redemption
0.actors: Tim Robbins, Morgan Freeman, Bob Gunton, William Sadler
0.plot: Two imprisoned men bond over a number of years, finding solace and eventual redemption through acts of common decency.

1.title: The Godfather
1.actors: Marlon Brando, Al Pacino, James Caan, Richard S. Castellano
1.plot: The aging patriarch of an organized crime dynasty transfers control of his clandestine empire to his reluctant son.

2.title: The Godfather: Part II
2.actors: Al Pacino, Robert Duvall, Diane Keaton, Robert De Niro
2.plot: The early life and career of Vito Corleone in 1920s New York City is portrayed, while his son, Michael, expands and tightens his grip on the family crime syndicate.

3.title: The Dark Knight
3.actors: Christian Bale, Heath Ledger, Aaron Eckhart, Michael Caine
3.plot: When the menace known as the Joker wreaks havoc and chaos on the people of Gotham, Batman must accept one of the greatest psychological and physical tests of his ability to fight injustice.

4.title: 12 Angry Men
4.actors: Martin Balsam, John Fiedler, Lee J. Cobb, E.G. Marshall
4.plot: A jury holdout attempts to prevent a miscarriage of justice by forcing his colleagues to reconsider the evidence.

5.title: Schindler's List
5.actors: Liam Neeson, Ben Kingsley, Ralph Fiennes, Caroline Goodall
5.plot: In German-occupied Poland during World War II, industrialist Oskar Schindler gradually becomes concerned for his Jewish workforce after witnessing their persecution by the Nazis.

6.title: Pulp Fiction
6.actors: Tim Roth, Amanda Plummer, Laura Lovelace, John Travolta
6.plot: The lives of two mob hitmen, a boxer, a gangster and his wife, and a pair of diner bandits intertwine in four tales of violence and redemption.

7.title: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly
7.actors: Eli Wallach, Clint Eastwood, Lee Van Cleef, Aldo Giuffrè
7.plot: A bounty hunting scam joins two men in an uneasy alliance against a third in a race to find a fortune in gold buried in a remote cemetery.

8.title: The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King
8.actors: Noel Appleby, Ali Astin, Sean Astin, David Aston
8.plot: Gandalf and Aragorn lead the World of Men against Sauron's army to draw his gaze from Frodo and Sam as they approach Mount Doom with the One Ring.

9.title: Fight Club
9.actors: Edward Norton, Brad Pitt, Meat Loaf, Zach Grenier
9.plot: An insomniac office worker and a devil-may-care soapmaker form an underground fight club that evolves into something much, much more.

10.title: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
10.actors: Alan Howard, Noel Appleby, Sean Astin, Sala Baker
10.plot: A meek Hobbit from the Shire and eight companions set out on a journey to destroy the powerful One Ring and save Middle-earth from the Dark Lord Sauron.

11.title: Star Wars: Episode V - The Empire Strikes Back
11.actors: Mark Hamill, Harrison Ford, Carrie Fisher, Billy Dee Williams
11.plot: After the Rebels are brutally overpowered by the Empire on the ice planet Hoth, Luke Skywalker begins Jedi training with Yoda, while his friends are pursued by Darth Vader and a bounty hunter named Boba Fett all over the galaxy.

12.title: Forrest Gump
12.actors: Tom Hanks, Rebecca Williams, Sally Field, Michael Conner Humphreys
12.plot: The presidencies of Kennedy and Johnson, the events of Vietnam, Watergate, and other history unfold through the perspective of an Alabama man with an IQ of 75.

13.title: Inception
13.actors: Leonardo DiCaprio, Joseph Gordon-Levitt, Ellen Page, Tom Hardy
13.plot: A thief who steals corporate secrets through the use of dream-sharing technology is given the inverse task of planting an idea into the mind of a C.E.O.

14.title: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest
14.actors: Jack Nicholson, Louise Fletcher, Will Sampson, Michael Berryman
14.plot: A criminal pleads insanity and is admitted to a mental institution, where he rebels against the oppressive nurse and rallies up the scared patients.

15.title: The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers
15.actors: Bruce Allpress, Sean Astin, John Bach, Sala Baker
15.plot: While Frodo and Sam edge closer to Mordor with the help of the shifty Gollum, the divided fellowship makes a stand against Sauron's new ally, Saruman, and his hordes of Isengard.

16.title: Goodfellas
16.actors: Robert De Niro, Ray Liotta, Joe Pesci, Lorraine Bracco
16.plot: The story of Henry Hill and his life in the mob, covering his relationship with his wife Karen Hill and his mob partners Jimmy Conway and Tommy DeVito in the Italian-American crime syndicate.

17.title: The Matrix
17.actors: Keanu Reeves, Laurence Fishburne, Carrie-Anne Moss, Hugo Weaving
17.plot: A computer hacker learns from mysterious rebels about the true nature of his reality and his role in the war against its controllers.

18.title: Star Wars: Episode IV - A New Hope
18.actors: Mark Hamill, Harrison Ford, Carrie Fisher, Peter Cushing
18.plot: Luke Skywalker joins forces with a Jedi Knight, a cocky pilot, a Wookiee and two droids to save the galaxy from the Empire's world-destroying battle station, while also attempting to rescue Princess Leia from the mysterious Darth Vader.

19.title: Seven Samurai
19.actors: Toshirô Mifune, Takashi Shimura, Keiko Tsushima, Yukiko Shimazaki
19.plot: A poor village under attack by bandits recruits seven unemployed samurai to help them defend themselves.

20.title: City of God
20.actors: Alexandre Rodrigues, Leandro Firmino, Phellipe Haagensen, Douglas Silva
20.plot: In the slums of Rio, two kids' paths diverge as one struggles to become a photographer and the other a kingpin.

21.title: Se7en
21.actors: Morgan Freeman, Andrew Kevin Walker, Daniel Zacapa, Brad Pitt
21.plot: Two detectives, a rookie and a veteran, hunt a serial killer who uses the seven deadly sins as his motives.

22.title: The Silence of the Lambs
22.actors: Jodie Foster, Lawrence A. Bonney, Kasi Lemmons, Lawrence T. Wrentz
22.plot: A young F.B.I. cadet must receive the help of an incarcerated and manipulative cannibal killer to help catch another serial killer, a madman who skins his victims.

23.title: The Usual Suspects
23.actors: Stephen Baldwin, Gabriel Byrne, Benicio Del Toro, Kevin Pollak
23.plot: A sole survivor tells of the twisty events leading up to a horrific gun battle on a boat, which began when five criminals met at a seemingly random police lineup.

24.title: It's a Wonderful Life
24.actors: James Stewart, Donna Reed, Lionel Barrymore, Thomas Mitchell
24.plot: An angel is sent from Heaven to help a desperately frustrated businessman by showing him what life would have been like if he had never existed.

25.title: Life Is Beautiful
25.actors: Roberto Benigni, Nicoletta Braschi, Giorgio Cantarini, Giustino Durano
25.plot: When an open-minded Jewish librarian and his son become victims of the Holocaust, he uses a perfect mixture of will, humor, and imagination to protect his son from the dangers around their camp.

26.title: Léon: The Professional
26.actors: Jean Reno, Gary Oldman, Natalie Portman, Danny Aiello
26.plot: Mathilda, a 12-year-old girl, is reluctantly taken in by Léon, a professional assassin, after her family is murdered. An unusual relationship forms as she becomes his protégée and learns the assassin's trade.

27.title: Once Upon a Time in the West
27.actors: Claudia Cardinale, Henry Fonda, Jason Robards, Charles Bronson
27.plot: A mysterious stranger with a harmonica joins forces with a notorious desperado to protect a beautiful widow from a ruthless assassin working for the railroad.

28.title: Interstellar
28.actors: Ellen Burstyn, Matthew McConaughey, Mackenzie Foy, John Lithgow
28.plot: A team of explorers travel through a wormhole in space in an attempt to ensure humanity's survival.

29.title: Saving Private Ryan
29.actors: Tom Hanks, Tom Sizemore, Edward Burns, Barry Pepper
29.plot: Following the Normandy Landings, a group of U.S. soldiers go behind enemy lines to retrieve a paratrooper whose brothers have been killed in action.

30.title: Spirited Away
30.actors: Rumi Hiiragi, Miyu Irino, Mari Natsuki, Takashi Naitô
30.plot: During her family's move to the suburbs, a sullen 10-year-old girl wanders into a world ruled by gods, witches, and spirits, and where humans are changed into beasts.

31.title: American History X
31.actors: Edward Norton, Edward Furlong, Beverly D'Angelo, Jennifer Lien
31.plot: A former neo-nazi skinhead tries to prevent his younger brother from going down the same wrong path that he did.

32.title: Casablanca
32.actors: Humphrey Bogart, Ingrid Bergman, Paul Henreid, Claude Rains
32.plot: A cynical American expatriate struggles to decide whether or not he should help his former lover and her fugitive husband escape French Morocco.

33.title: Raiders of the Lost Ark
33.actors: Harrison Ford, Karen Allen, Paul Freeman, Ronald Lacey
33.plot: In 1936, archaeologist and adventurer Indiana Jones is hired by the U.S. government to find the Ark of the Covenant before Adolf Hitler's Nazis can obtain its awesome powers.

34.title: Psycho
34.actors: Anthony Perkins, Vera Miles, John Gavin, Janet Leigh
34.plot: A Phoenix secretary embezzles forty thousand dollars from her employer's client, goes on the run, and checks into a remote motel run by a young man under the domination of his mother.

35.title: City Lights
35.actors: Virginia Cherrill, Florence Lee, Harry Myers, Al Ernest Garcia
35.plot: With the aid of a wealthy erratic tippler, a dewy-eyed tramp who has fallen in love with a sightless flower girl accumulates money to be able to help her medically.

36.title: Rear Window
36.actors: James Stewart, Grace Kelly, Wendell Corey, Thelma Ritter
36.plot: A wheelchair-bound photographer spies on his neighbors from his apartment window and becomes convinced one of them has committed murder.

37.title: The Intouchables
37.actors: François Cluzet, Omar Sy, Anne Le Ny, Audrey Fleurot
37.plot: After he becomes a quadriplegic from a paragliding accident, an aristocrat hires a young man from the projects to be his caregiver.

38.title: Modern Times
38.actors: Charles Chaplin, Paulette Goddard, Henry Bergman, Tiny Sandford
38.plot: The Tramp struggles to live in modern industrial society with the help of a young homeless woman.

39.title: Terminator 2: Judgment Day
39.actors: Arnold Schwarzenegger, Linda Hamilton, Edward Furlong, Robert Patrick
39.plot: A cyborg, identical to the one who failed to kill Sarah Connor, must now protect her teenage son, John Connor, from a more advanced and powerful cyborg.

40.title: Whiplash
40.actors: Miles Teller, J.K. Simmons, Paul Reiser, Melissa Benoist
40.plot: A promising young drummer enrolls at a cut-throat music conservatory where his dreams of greatness are mentored by an instructor who will stop at nothing to realize a student's potential.

41.title: The Green Mile
41.actors: Tom Hanks, David Morse, Bonnie Hunt, Michael Clarke Duncan
41.plot: The lives of guards on Death Row are affected by one of their charges: a black man accused of child murder and rape, yet who has a mysterious gift.

42.title: The Pianist
42.actors: Adrien Brody, Emilia Fox, Michal Zebrowski, Ed Stoppard
42.plot: A Polish Jewish musician struggles to survive the destruction of the Warsaw ghetto of World War II.

43.title: Memento
43.actors: Guy Pearce, Carrie-Anne Moss, Joe Pantoliano, Mark Boone Junior
43.plot: A man with short-term memory loss attempts to track down his wife's murderer.

44.title: The Departed
44.actors: Leonardo DiCaprio, Matt Damon, Jack Nicholson, Mark Wahlberg
44.plot: An undercover cop and a mole in the police attempt to identify each other while infiltrating an Irish gang in South Boston.

45.title: Gladiator
45.actors: Russell Crowe, Joaquin Phoenix, Connie Nielsen, Oliver Reed
45.plot: A former Roman General sets out to exact vengeance against the corrupt emperor who murdered his family and sent him into slavery.

46.title: Apocalypse Now
46.actors: Marlon Brando, Martin Sheen, Robert Duvall, Frederic Forrest
46.plot: A U.S. Army officer serving in Vietnam is tasked with assassinating a renegade Special Forces Colonel who sees himself as a god.

47.title: Back to the Future
47.actors: Michael J. Fox, Christopher Lloyd, Lea Thompson, Crispin Glover
47.plot: Marty McFly, a 17-year-old high school student, is accidentally sent thirty years into the past in a time-traveling DeLorean invented by his close friend, the eccentric scientist Doc Brown.

48.title: Sunset Blvd.
48.actors: William Holden, Gloria Swanson, Erich von Stroheim, Nancy Olson
48.plot: A screenwriter develops a dangerous relationship with a faded film star determined to make a triumphant return.

49.title: Dr. Strangelove or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb
49.actors: Peter Sellers, George C. Scott, Sterling Hayden, Keenan Wynn
49.plot: An insane general triggers a path to nuclear holocaust that a War Room full of politicians and generals frantically tries to stop.

50.title: The Prestige
50.actors: Hugh Jackman, Christian Bale, Michael Caine, Piper Perabo
50.plot: After a tragic accident, two stage magicians engage in a battle to create the ultimate illusion while sacrificing everything they have to outwit each other.

51.title: Alien
51.actors: Tom Skerritt, Sigourney Weaver, Veronica Cartwright, Harry Dean Stanton
51.plot: After a space merchant vessel receives an unknown transmission as a distress call, one of the crew is attacked by a mysterious life form and they soon realize that its life cycle has merely begun.

52.title: The Lion King
52.actors: Rowan Atkinson, Matthew Broderick, Niketa Calame-Harris, Jim Cummings
52.plot: A Lion cub crown prince is tricked by a treacherous uncle into thinking he caused his father's death and flees into exile in despair, only to learn in adulthood his identity and his responsibilities.

53.title: The Lives of Others
53.actors: Martina Gedeck, Ulrich Mühe, Sebastian Koch, Ulrich Tukur
53.plot: In 1984 East Berlin, an agent of the secret police, conducting surveillance on a writer and his lover, finds himself becoming increasingly absorbed by their lives.

54.title: The Great Dictator
54.actors: Charles Chaplin, Jack Oakie, Reginald Gardiner, Henry Daniell
54.plot: Dictator Adenoid Hynkel tries to expand his empire while a poor Jewish barber tries to avoid persecution from Hynkel's regime.

55.title: Inside Out
55.actors: Amy Poehler, Phyllis Smith, Richard Kind, Bill Hader
55.plot: After young Riley is uprooted from her Midwest life and moved to San Francisco, her emotions - Joy, Fear, Anger, Disgust and Sadness - conflict on how best to navigate a new city, house, and school.

56.title: Cinema Paradiso
56.actors: Antonella Attili, Enzo Cannavale, Isa Danieli, Leo Gullotta
56.plot: A filmmaker recalls his childhood when falling in love with the pictures at the cinema of his home village and forms a deep friendship with the cinema's projectionist.

57.title: The Shining
57.actors: Jack Nicholson, Shelley Duvall, Danny Lloyd, Scatman Crothers
57.plot: A family heads to an isolated hotel for the winter where a sinister presence influences the father into violence, while his psychic son sees horrific forebodings from both past and future.

58.title: Paths of Glory
58.actors: Kirk Douglas, Ralph Meeker, Adolphe Menjou, George Macready
58.plot: After refusing to attack an enemy position, a general accuses the soldiers of cowardice and their commanding officer must defend them.

59.title: Django Unchained
59.actors: Jamie Foxx, Christoph Waltz, Leonardo DiCaprio, Kerry Washington
59.plot: With the help of a German bounty hunter, a freed slave sets out to rescue his wife from a brutal Mississippi plantation owner.

60.title: The Dark Knight Rises
60.actors: Christian Bale, Gary Oldman, Tom Hardy, Joseph Gordon-Levitt
60.plot: Eight years after the Joker's reign of anarchy, Batman, with the help of the enigmatic Catwoman, is forced from his exile to save Gotham City from the brutal guerrilla terrorist Bane.

61.title: WALL·E
61.actors: Ben Burtt, Elissa Knight, Jeff Garlin, Fred Willard
61.plot: In the distant future, a small waste-collecting robot inadvertently embarks on a space journey that will ultimately decide the fate of mankind.

62.title: American Beauty
62.actors: Kevin Spacey, Annette Bening, Thora Birch, Wes Bentley
62.plot: A sexually frustrated suburban father has a mid-life crisis after becoming infatuated with his daughter's best friend.

63.title: Grave of the Fireflies
63.actors: Tsutomu Tatsumi, Ayano Shiraishi, Yoshiko Shinohara, Akemi Yamaguchi
63.plot: A young boy and his little sister struggle to survive in Japan during World War II.

64.title: Aliens
64.actors: Sigourney Weaver, Carrie Henn, Michael Biehn, Paul Reiser
64.plot: Ellen Ripley is rescued by a deep salvage team after being in hypersleep for 57 years. The moon that the Nostromo visited has been colonized, but contact is lost. This time, colonial marines have impressive firepower, but will that be enough?

65.title: Citizen Kane
65.actors: Joseph Cotten, Dorothy Comingore, Agnes Moorehead, Ruth Warrick
65.plot: Following the death of publishing tycoon Charles Foster Kane, reporters scramble to uncover the meaning of his final utterance; 'Rosebud'.

66.title: North by Northwest
66.actors: Cary Grant, Eva Marie Saint, James Mason, Jessie Royce Landis
66.plot: A New York City advertising executive goes on the run after being mistaken for a government agent by a group of foreign spies.

67.title: Princess Mononoke
67.actors: Billy Crudup, Billy Bob Thornton, Minnie Driver, John DiMaggio
67.plot: On a journey to find the cure for a Tatarigami's curse, Ashitaka finds himself in the middle of a war between the forest gods and Tatara, a mining colony. In this quest he also meets San, the Mononoke Hime.

68.title: Old Boy
68.actors: Ye Liu, Ariel Lin, Jiayin Lei, Xianxu Hu

69.title: Vertigo
69.actors: James Stewart, Kim Novak, Barbara Bel Geddes, Tom Helmore
69.plot: A former police detective juggles wrestling with his personal demons and becoming obsessed with a hauntingly beautiful woman.

70.title: Das Boot
70.actors: Jürgen Prochnow, Herbert Grönemeyer, Klaus Wennemann, Hubertus Bengsch
70.plot: The claustrophobic world of a WWII German U-boat; boredom, filth and sheer terror.

71.title: Star Wars: Episode VI - Return of the Jedi
71.actors: Mark Hamill, Harrison Ford, Carrie Fisher, Billy Dee Williams
71.plot: After a daring mission to rescue Han Solo from Jabba the Hutt, the Rebels dispatch to Endor to destroy the second Death Star. Meanwhile, Luke struggles to help Darth Vader back from the dark side without falling into the Emperor's trap.

72.title: M
72.actors: Peter Lorre, Ellen Widmann, Inge Landgut, Otto Wernicke
72.plot: When the police in a German city are unable to catch a child-murderer, other criminals join in the manhunt.

73.title: Amélie
73.actors: Audrey Tautou, Mathieu Kassovitz, Rufus, Lorella Cravotta
73.plot: Amélie is an innocent and naive girl in Paris with her own sense of justice. She decides to help those around her and, along the way, discovers love.

74.title: Witness for the Prosecution
74.actors: Tyrone Power, Marlene Dietrich, Charles Laughton, Elsa Lanchester
74.plot: A veteran British barrister must defend his client in a murder trial that has surprise after surprise.

75.title: Reservoir Dogs
75.actors: Harvey Keitel, Tim Roth, Michael Madsen, Chris Penn
75.plot: When a simple jewelry heist goes horribly wrong, the surviving criminals begin to suspect that one of them is a police informant.

76.title: Braveheart
76.actors: James Robinson, Sean Lawlor, Sandy Nelson, James Cosmo
76.plot: When his secret bride is executed for assaulting an English soldier who tried to rape her, William Wallace begins a revolt against King Edward I of England.

77.title: Toy Story 3
77.actors: Tom Hanks, Tim Allen, Joan Cusack, Ned Beatty
77.plot: The toys are mistakenly delivered to a day-care center instead of the attic right before Andy leaves for college, and it's up to Woody to convince the other toys that they weren't abandoned and to return home.

78.title: A Clockwork Orange
78.actors: Malcolm McDowell, Patrick Magee, Michael Bates, Warren Clarke
78.plot: In the future, a sadistic gang leader is imprisoned and volunteers for a conduct-aversion experiment, but it doesn't go as planned.

79.title: Taxi Driver
79.actors: Diahnne Abbott, Robinson Frank Adu, Victor Argo, Gino Ardito
79.plot: A mentally unstable veteran works as a nighttime taxi driver in New York City, where the perceived decadence and sleaze fuels his urge for violent action by attempting to liberate a presidential campaign worker and an underage prostitute.

80.title: Double Indemnity
80.actors: Fred MacMurray, Barbara Stanwyck, Edward G. Robinson, Porter Hall
80.plot: An insurance representative lets himself be talked by a seductive housewife into a murder/insurance fraud scheme that arouses the suspicion of an insurance investigator.

81.title: Requiem for a Dream
81.actors: Ellen Burstyn, Jared Leto, Jennifer Connelly, Marlon Wayans
81.plot: The drug-induced utopias of four Coney Island people are shattered when their addictions run deep.

82.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
82.actors: Gregory Peck, John Megna, Frank Overton, Rosemary Murphy
82.plot: Atticus Finch, a lawyer in the Depression-era South, defends a black man against an undeserved rape charge, and his children against prejudice.

83.title: Lawrence of Arabia
83.actors: Peter O'Toole, Alec Guinness, Anthony Quinn, Jack Hawkins
83.plot: The story of T.E. Lawrence, the English officer who successfully united and led the diverse, often warring, Arab tribes during World War I in order to fight the Turks.

84.title: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind
84.actors: Jim Carrey, Kate Winslet, Gerry Robert Byrne, Elijah Wood
84.plot: When their relationship turns sour, a couple undergoes a medical procedure to have each other erased from their memories.

85.title: Full Metal Jacket
85.actors: Matthew Modine, Adam Baldwin, Vincent D'Onofrio, R. Lee Ermey
85.plot: A pragmatic U.S. Marine observes the dehumanizing effects the Vietnam War has on his fellow recruits from their brutal boot camp training to the bloody street fighting in Hue.

86.title: The Sting
86.actors: Paul Newman, Robert Redford, Robert Shaw, Charles Durning
86.plot: Two grifters team up to pull off the ultimate con.

87.title: Amadeus
87.actors: F. Murray Abraham, Tom Hulce, Elizabeth Berridge, Roy Dotrice
87.plot: The life, success and troubles of Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart, as told by Antonio Salieri, the contemporaneous composer who was insanely jealous of Mozart's talent and claimed to have murdered him.

88.title: Bicycle Thieves
88.actors: Lamberto Maggiorani, Enzo Staiola, Lianella Carell, Elena Altieri
88.plot: In post-war Italy, a working-class man's bicycle is stolen. He and his son set out to find it.

89.title: Singin' in the Rain
89.actors: Gene Kelly, Donald O'Connor, Debbie Reynolds, Jean Hagen
89.plot: A silent film production company and cast make a difficult transition to sound.

90.title: Monty Python and the Holy Grail
90.actors: Graham Chapman, John Cleese, Eric Idle, Terry Gilliam
90.plot: King Arthur and his Knights of the Round Table embark on a surreal, low-budget search for the Holy Grail, encountering many, very silly obstacles.

91.title: 2001: A Space Odyssey
91.actors: Keir Dullea, Gary Lockwood, William Sylvester, Daniel Richter
91.plot: After discovering a mysterious artifact buried beneath the Lunar surface, mankind sets off on a quest to find its origins with help from intelligent supercomputer H.A.L. 9000.

92.title: Snatch
92.actors: Benicio Del Toro, Dennis Farina, Vinnie Jones, Brad Pitt
92.plot: Unscrupulous boxing promoters, violent bookmakers, a Russian gangster, incompetent amateur robbers and supposedly Jewish jewelers fight to track down a priceless stolen diamond.

93.title: The Kid
93.actors: Carl Miller, Edna Purviance, Jackie Coogan, Charles Chaplin
93.plot: The Tramp cares for an abandoned child, but events put that relationship in jeopardy.

94.title: L.A. Confidential
94.actors: Kevin Spacey, Russell Crowe, Guy Pearce, James Cromwell
94.plot: As corruption grows in 1950s Los Angeles, three policemen -- one strait-laced, one brutal, and one sleazy -- investigate a series of murders with their own brand of justice.

95.title: Rashomon
95.actors: Toshirô Mifune, Machiko Kyô, Masayuki Mori, Takashi Shimura
95.plot: The rape of a bride and the murder of her samurai husband are recalled from the perspectives of a bandit, the bride, the samurai's ghost and a woodcutter.

96.title: For a Few Dollars More
96.actors: Clint Eastwood, Lee Van Cleef, Gian Maria Volontè, Mario Brega
96.plot: Two bounty hunters with the same intentions team up to track down a Western outlaw.

97.title: Toy Story
97.actors: Tom Hanks, Tim Allen, Don Rickles, Jim Varney
97.plot: A cowboy doll is profoundly threatened and jealous when a new spaceman figure supplants him as top toy in a boy's room.

98.title: Inglourious Basterds
98.actors: Brad Pitt, Mélanie Laurent, Christoph Waltz, Eli Roth
98.plot: In Nazi-occupied France during World War II, a plan to assassinate Nazi leaders by a group of Jewish U.S. soldiers coincides with a theatre owner's vengeful plans for the same.

99.title: The Apartment
99.actors: Jack Lemmon, Shirley MacLaine, Fred MacMurray, Ray Walston
99.plot: A man tries to rise in his company by letting its executives use his apartment for trysts, but complications and a romance of his own ensue.

100.title: All About Eve
100.actors: Bette Davis, Anne Baxter, George Sanders, Celeste Holm
100.plot: An ingénue insinuates herself into the lives of an established but aging stage actress and her circle of theater friends.

101.title: The Treasure of the Sierra Madre
101.actors: Humphrey Bogart, Walter Huston, Tim Holt, Bruce Bennett
101.plot: Two Americans searching for work in Mexico convince an old prospector to help them mine for gold in the Sierra Madre Mountains.

102.title: Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade
102.actors: Harrison Ford, Sean Connery, Denholm Elliott, Alison Doody
102.plot: In 1938, after his father Professor Henry Jones, Sr. goes missing while pursuing the Holy Grail, Professor Henry "Indiana" Jones, Jr. finds himself up against Adolf Hitler's Nazis again to stop them from obtaining its powers.

103.title: Une séparation
103.actors: Nicolas Abraham, Mélanie Leray, Raphaël Krepser
103.plot: Gomez has come to pick up some stuff from Magalie's place after their recent break-up...

104.title: Metropolis
104.actors: Alfred Abel, Gustav Fröhlich, Rudolf Klein-Rogge, Fritz Rasp
104.plot: In a futuristic city sharply divided between the working class and the city planners, the son of the city's mastermind falls in love with a working class prophet who predicts the coming of a savior to mediate their differences.

105.title: Yojimbo
105.actors: Toshirô Mifune, Tatsuya Nakadai, Yôko Tsukasa, Isuzu Yamada
105.plot: A crafty ronin comes to a town divided by two criminal gangs and decides to play them against each other to free the town.

106.title: The Third Man
106.actors: Joseph Cotten, Alida Valli, Orson Welles, Trevor Howard
106.plot: Pulp novelist Holly Martins travels to shadowy, postwar Vienna, only to find himself investigating the mysterious death of an old friend, Harry Lime.

107.title: Scarface
107.actors: Al Pacino, Steven Bauer, Michelle Pfeiffer, Mary Elizabeth Mastrantonio
107.plot: In 1980 Miami, a determined Cuban immigrant takes over a drug cartel and succumbs to greed.

108.title: Batman Begins
108.actors: Christian Bale, Michael Caine, Liam Neeson, Katie Holmes
108.plot: After training with his mentor, Batman begins his fight to free crime-ridden Gotham City from corruption.

109.title: Some Like It Hot
109.actors: Marilyn Monroe, Tony Curtis, Jack Lemmon, George Raft
109.plot: When two male musicians witness a mob hit, they flee the state in an all-female band disguised as women, but further complications set in.

110.title: Unforgiven
110.actors: Clint Eastwood, Gene Hackman, Morgan Freeman, Richard Harris
110.plot: Retired Old West gunslinger William Munny (Clint Eastwood) reluctantly takes on one last job, with the help of his old partner Ned Logan (Morgan Freeman) and a young man, The "Schofield Kid" (Jaimz Woolvett).

111.title: 3 Idiots
111.actors: Aamir Khan, Madhavan, Sharman Joshi, Kareena Kapoor
111.plot: Two friends are searching for their long lost companion. They revisit their college days and recall the memories of their friend who inspired them to think differently, even as the rest of the world called them "idiots".

112.title: Up
112.actors: Edward Asner, Christopher Plummer, Jordan Nagai, Bob Peterson
112.plot: 78-year-old Carl Fredricksen travels to Paradise Falls in his house equipped with balloons, inadvertently taking a young stowaway.

113.title: Raging Bull
113.actors: Robert De Niro, Cathy Moriarty, Joe Pesci, Frank Vincent
113.plot: The life of boxer Jake LaMotta, whose violence and temper that led him to the top in the ring destroyed his life outside of it.

114.title: Downfall
114.actors: Bruno Ganz, Alexandra Maria Lara, Corinna Harfouch, Ulrich Matthes
114.plot: Traudl Junge, the final secretary for Adolf Hitler, tells of the Nazi dictator's final days in his Berlin bunker at the end of WWII.

115.title: The Hunt
115.actors: Mads Mikkelsen, Thomas Bo Larsen, Annika Wedderkopp, Lasse Fogelstrøm
115.plot: A teacher lives a lonely life, all the while struggling over his son's custody. His life slowly gets better as he finds love and receives good news from his son, but his new luck is about to be brutally shattered by an innocent little lie.

116.title: Chinatown
116.actors: Jack Nicholson, Faye Dunaway, John Huston, Perry Lopez
116.plot: A private detective hired to expose an adulterer finds himself caught up in a web of deceit, corruption, and murder.

117.title: The Great Escape
117.actors: Steve McQueen, James Garner, Richard Attenborough, James Donald
117.plot: Allied prisoners of war plan for several hundred of their number to escape from a German camp during World War II.

118.title: Die Hard
118.actors: Bruce Willis, Bonnie Bedelia, Reginald VelJohnson, Paul Gleason
118.plot: An NYPD officer tries to save his wife and several others taken hostage by German terrorists during a Christmas party at the Nakatomi Plaza in Los Angeles.

119.title: Good Will Hunting
119.actors: Matt Damon, Ben Affleck, Stellan Skarsgård, John Mighton
119.plot: Will Hunting, a janitor at M.I.T., has a gift for mathematics, but needs help from a psychologist to find direction in his life.

120.title: Mad Max: Fury Road
120.actors: Tom Hardy, Charlize Theron, Nicholas Hoult, Hugh Keays-Byrne
120.plot: In a post-apocalyptic wasteland, a woman rebels against a tyrannical ruler in search for her homeland with the aid of a group of female prisoners, a psychotic worshiper, and a drifter named Max.

121.title: Heat
121.actors: Al Pacino, Robert De Niro, Val Kilmer, Jon Voight
121.plot: A group of professional bank robbers start to feel the heat from police when they unknowingly leave a clue at their latest heist.

122.title: On the Waterfront
122.actors: Marlon Brando, Karl Malden, Lee J. Cobb, Rod Steiger
122.plot: An ex-prize fighter turned longshoreman struggles to stand up to his corrupt union bosses.

123.title: Pan's Labyrinth
123.actors: Ivana Baquero, Sergi López, Maribel Verdú, Doug Jones
123.plot: In the Falangist Spain of 1944, the bookish young stepdaughter of a sadistic army officer escapes into an eerie but captivating fantasy world.

124.title: Mr. Smith Goes to Washington
124.actors: Jean Arthur, James Stewart, Claude Rains, Edward Arnold
124.plot: A naive man is appointed to fill a vacancy in the United States Senate. His plans promptly collide with political corruption, but he doesn't back down.

125.title: The Bridge on the River Kwai
125.actors: William Holden, Alec Guinness, Jack Hawkins, Sessue Hayakawa
125.plot: British POWs build a railway bridge across the river Kwai for their Japanese captors, oblivious of the Allies' plans to destroy it.

126.title: My Neighbor Totoro
126.actors: Noriko Hidaka, Chika Sakamoto, Shigesato Itoi, Sumi Shimamoto
126.plot: When two girls move to the country to be near their ailing mother, they have adventures with the wondrous forest spirits who live nearby.

127.title: Ran
127.actors: Tatsuya Nakadai, Akira Terao, Jinpachi Nezu, Daisuke Ryû
127.plot: In Medieval Japan, an elderly warlord retires, handing over his empire to his three sons. However, he vastly underestimates how the new-found power will corrupt them and cause them to turn on each other...and him.

128.title: The Gold Rush
128.actors: Charles Chaplin, Mack Swain, Tom Murray, Henry Bergman
128.plot: A prospector goes to the Klondike in search of gold and finds it and more.

129.title: Vivre Sa Vie
129.actors: Anna Karina, Sady Rebbot, André S. Labarthe, Guylaine Schlumberger
129.plot: Twelve episodic tales in the life of a Parisian woman and her slow descent into prostitution.

130.title: The Seventh Seal
130.actors: Gunnar Björnstrand, Bengt Ekerot, Nils Poppe, Max von Sydow
130.plot: A man seeks answers about life, death, and the existence of God as he plays chess against the Grim Reaper during the Black Plague.

131.title: Blade Runner
131.actors: Harrison Ford, Rutger Hauer, Sean Young, Edward James Olmos
131.plot: A blade runner must pursue and terminate four replicants who stole a ship in space, and have returned to Earth to find their creator.

132.title: The Secret in Their Eyes
132.actors: Soledad Villamil, Ricardo Darín, Carla Quevedo, Pablo Rago
132.plot: A retired legal counselor writes a novel hoping to find closure for one of his past unresolved homicide cases and for his unreciprocated love with his superior - both of which still haunt him decades later.

133.title: Wild Strawberries
133.actors: Victor Sjöström, Bibi Andersson, Ingrid Thulin, Gunnar Björnstrand
133.plot: After living a life marked by coldness, an aging professor is forced to confront the emptiness of his existence.

134.title: The General
134.actors: Marion Mack, Glen Cavender, Jim Farley, Frederick Vroom
134.plot: When Union spies steal an engineer's beloved locomotive, he pursues it single-handedly and straight through enemy lines.

135.title: Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels
135.actors: Jason Flemyng, Dexter Fletcher, Nick Moran, Jason Statham
135.plot: A botched card game in London triggers four friends, thugs, weed-growers, hard gangsters, loan sharks and debt collectors to collide with each other in a series of unexpected events, all for the sake of weed, cash and two antique shotguns.

136.title: The Elephant Man
136.actors: Anthony Hopkins, John Hurt, Anne Bancroft, John Gielgud
136.plot: A Victorian surgeon rescues a heavily disfigured man who is mistreated while scraping a living as a side-show freak. Behind his monstrous façade, there is revealed a person of kindness, intelligence and sophistication.

137.title: Casino
137.actors: Robert De Niro, Sharon Stone, Joe Pesci, James Woods
137.plot: A tale of greed, deception, money, power, and murder occur between two best friends: a mafia enforcer and a casino executive, compete against each other over a gambling empire, and over a fast living and fast loving socialite.

138.title: Howl's Moving Castle
138.actors: Chieko Baishô, Takuya Kimura, Akihiro Miwa, Tatsuya Gashûin
138.plot: When an unconfident young woman is cursed with an old body by a spiteful witch, her only chance of breaking the spell lies with a self-indulgent yet insecure young wizard and his companions in his legged, walking castle.

139.title: The Wolf of Wall Street
139.actors: Leonardo DiCaprio, Jonah Hill, Margot Robbie, Matthew McConaughey
139.plot: Based on the true story of Jordan Belfort, from his rise to a wealthy stock-broker living the high life to his fall involving crime, corruption and the federal government.

140.title: Warrior
140.actors: Joel Edgerton, Tom Hardy, Nick Nolte, Jennifer Morrison
140.plot: The youngest son of an alcoholic former boxer returns home, where he's trained by his father for competition in a mixed martial arts tournament - a path that puts the fighter on a collision course with his estranged, older brother.

141.title: Gran Torino
141.actors: Clint Eastwood, Christopher Carley, Bee Vang, Ahney Her
141.plot: Disgruntled Korean War veteran Walt Kowalski sets out to reform his neighbor, Thao Lor, a Hmong teenager who tried to steal Kowalski's prized possession: a 1972 Gran Torino.

142.title: V for Vendetta
142.actors: Natalie Portman, Hugo Weaving, Stephen Rea, Stephen Fry
142.plot: In a future British tyranny, a shadowy freedom fighter, known only by the alias of "V", plots to overthrow it with the help of a young woman.

143.title: The Big Lebowski
143.actors: Jeff Bridges, John Goodman, Julianne Moore, Steve Buscemi
143.plot: Jeff "The Dude" Lebowski, mistaken for a millionaire of the same name, seeks restitution for his ruined rug and enlists his bowling buddies to help get it.

144.title: Rebecca
144.actors: Laurence Olivier, Joan Fontaine, George Sanders, Judith Anderson
144.plot: A self-conscious woman juggles adjusting to her new role as an aristocrat's wife and avoiding being intimidated by his first wife's spectral presence.

145.title: Judgment at Nuremberg
145.actors: Spencer Tracy, Burt Lancaster, Richard Widmark, Marlene Dietrich
145.plot: In 1948, an American court in occupied Germany tries four Nazis judged for war crimes.

146.title: A Beautiful Mind
146.actors: Russell Crowe, Ed Harris, Jennifer Connelly, Christopher Plummer
146.plot: After John Nash, a brilliant but asocial mathematician, accepts secret work in cryptography, his life takes a turn for the nightmarish.

147.title: How to Train Your Dragon
147.actors: Jay Baruchel, Gerard Butler, Craig Ferguson, America Ferrera
147.plot: A hapless young Viking who aspires to hunt dragons becomes the unlikely friend of a young dragon himself, and learns there may be more to the creatures than he assumed.

148.title: The Deer Hunter
148.actors: Robert De Niro, John Cazale, John Savage, Christopher Walken
148.plot: An in-depth examination of the ways in which the U.S. Vietnam War impacts and disrupts the lives of people in a small industrial town in Pennsylvania.

149.title: Cool Hand Luke
149.actors: Paul Newman, George Kennedy, J.D. Cannon, Lou Antonio
149.plot: A laid back Southern man is sentenced to two years in a rural prison, but refuses to conform.

150.title: Gone with the Wind
150.actors: Thomas Mitchell, Barbara O'Neil, Vivien Leigh, Evelyn Keyes
150.plot: A manipulative woman and a roguish man conduct a turbulent romance during the American Civil War and Reconstruction periods.

151.title: Fargo
151.actors: William H. Macy, Steve Buscemi, Peter Stormare, Kristin Rudrüd
151.plot: Jerry Lundegaard's inept crime falls apart due to his and his henchmen's bungling and the persistent police work of the quite pregnant Marge Gunderson.

152.title: Trainspotting
152.actors: Ewan McGregor, Ewen Bremner, Jonny Lee Miller, Kevin McKidd
152.plot: Renton, deeply immersed in the Edinburgh drug scene, tries to clean up and get out, despite the allure of the drugs and influence of friends.

153.title: It Happened One Night
153.actors: Clark Gable, Claudette Colbert, Walter Connolly, Roscoe Karns
153.plot: A spoiled heiress running away from her family is helped by a man who is actually a reporter in need of a story.

154.title: Dial M for Murder
154.actors: Ray Milland, Grace Kelly, Robert Cummings, John Williams
154.plot: A tennis player frames his neglected wife for murder after she inadvertently foils his plan to have her murdered.

155.title: Into the Wild
155.actors: Emile Hirsch, Marcia Gay Harden, William Hurt, Jena Malone
155.plot: After graduating from Emory University, top student and athlete Christopher McCandless abandons his possessions, gives his entire $24,000 savings account to charity and hitchhikes to Alaska to live in the wilderness. Along the way, Christopher encounters a series of characters that shape his life.

156.title: Gone Girl
156.actors: Ben Affleck, Rosamund Pike, Neil Patrick Harris, Tyler Perry
156.plot: With his wife's disappearance having become the focus of an intense media circus, a man sees the spotlight turned on him when it's suspected that he may not be innocent.

157.title: The Sixth Sense
157.actors: Bruce Willis, Haley Joel Osment, Toni Collette, Olivia Williams
157.plot: A boy who communicates with spirits seeks the help of a disheartened child psychologist.

158.title: Rush
158.actors: Chris Hemsworth, Daniel Brühl, Olivia Wilde, Alexandra Maria Lara
158.plot: The merciless 1970s rivalry between Formula One rivals James Hunt and Niki Lauda.

159.title: Finding Nemo
159.actors: Albert Brooks, Ellen DeGeneres, Alexander Gould, Willem Dafoe
159.plot: After his son is captured in the Great Barrier Reef and taken to Sydney, a timid clownfish sets out on a journey to bring him home.

160.title: The Maltese Falcon
160.actors: Humphrey Bogart, Mary Astor, Gladys George, Peter Lorre
160.plot: A private detective takes on a case that involves him with three eccentric criminals, a gorgeous liar, and their quest for a priceless statuette.

161.title: No Country for Old Men
161.actors: Tommy Lee Jones, Javier Bardem, Josh Brolin, Woody Harrelson
161.plot: Violence and mayhem ensue after a hunter stumbles upon a drug deal gone wrong and more than two million dollars in cash near the Rio Grande.

162.title: The Thing
162.actors: Kurt Russell, Wilford Brimley, T.K. Carter, David Clennon
162.plot: A research team in Antarctica is hunted by a shape-shifting alien that assumes the appearance of its victims.

163.title: Incendies
163.actors: Mustafa Kamel, Hussein Sami, Rémy Girard, Mélissa Désormeaux-Poulin
163.plot: Twins journey to the Middle East to discover their family history and fulfill their mother's last wishes.

164.title: Kill Bill: Vol. 1
164.actors: Uma Thurman, Lucy Liu, Vivica A. Fox, Daryl Hannah
164.plot: After awakening from a four-year coma, a former assassin wreaks vengeance on the team of assassins who betrayed her.

165.title: Hotel Rwanda
165.actors: Xolani Mali, Don Cheadle, Desmond Dube, Hakeem Kae-Kazim
165.plot: Paul Rusesabagina was a hotel manager who housed over a thousand Tutsi refugees during their struggle against the Hutu militia in Rwanda.

166.title: Monty Python's Life of Brian
166.actors: Graham Chapman, John Cleese, Terry Gilliam, Eric Idle
166.plot: Born on the original Christmas in the stable next door to Jesus, Brian of Nazareth spends his life being mistaken for a messiah.

167.title: Platoon
167.actors: Keith David, Forest Whitaker, Francesco Quinn, Kevin Dillon
167.plot: A young soldier in Vietnam faces a moral crisis when confronted with the horrors of war and the duality of man.

168.title: The Wages of Fear
168.actors: Yves Montand, Charles Vanel, Folco Lulli, Peter van Eyck
168.plot: In a decrepit South American village, four men are hired to transport an urgent nitroglycerine shipment without the equipment that would make it safe.

169.title: Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid
169.actors: Paul Newman, Robert Redford, Katharine Ross, Strother Martin
169.plot: Wyoming, early 1900s. Butch Cassidy and The Sundance Kid are the leaders of a band of outlaws. After a train robbery goes wrong they find themselves on the run with a posse hard on their heels. Their solution - escape to Bolivia.

170.title: There Will Be Blood
170.actors: Daniel Day-Lewis, Martin Stringer, Matthew Braden Stringer, Jacob Stringer
170.plot: A story of family, religion, hatred, oil and madness, focusing on a turn-of-the-century prospector in the early days of the business.

171.title: Network
171.actors: Faye Dunaway, William Holden, Peter Finch, Robert Duvall
171.plot: A television network cynically exploits a deranged former anchor's ravings and revelations about the news media for its own profit.

172.title: Touch of Evil
172.actors: Charlton Heston, Janet Leigh, Orson Welles, Joseph Calleia
172.plot: A stark, perverse story of murder, kidnapping, and police corruption in a Mexican border town.

173.title: The 400 Blows
173.actors: Jean-Pierre Léaud, Claire Maurier, Albert Rémy, Guy Decomble
173.plot: A young boy, left without attention, delves into a life of petty crime.

174.title: Stand by Me
174.actors: Wil Wheaton, River Phoenix, Corey Feldman, Jerry O'Connell
174.plot: After the death of one of his friends, a writer recounts a boyhood journey with his friends to find the body of a missing boy.

175.title: 12 Years a Slave
175.actors: Chiwetel Ejiofor, Dwight Henry, Dickie Gravois, Bryan Batt
175.plot: In the antebellum United States, Solomon Northup, a free black man from upstate New York, is abducted and sold into slavery.

176.title: The Princess Bride
176.actors: Cary Elwes, Mandy Patinkin, Chris Sarandon, Christopher Guest
176.plot: While home sick in bed, a young boy's grandfather reads him the story of a farmboy-turned-pirate who encounters numerous obstacles, enemies and allies in his quest to be reunited with his true love.

177.title: Annie Hall
177.actors: Woody Allen, Diane Keaton, Tony Roberts, Carol Kane
177.plot: Neurotic New York comedian Alvy Singer falls in love with the ditzy Annie Hall.

178.title: Persona
178.actors: Bibi Andersson, Liv Ullmann, Margaretha Krook, Gunnar Björnstrand
178.plot: A nurse is put in charge of a mute actress and finds that their personae are melding together.

179.title: Amores Perros
179.actors: Emilio Echevarría, Gael García Bernal, Goya Toledo, Álvaro Guerrero
179.plot: A horrific car accident connects three stories, each involving characters dealing with loss, regret, and life's harsh realities, all in the name of love.

180.title: The Grand Budapest Hotel
180.actors: Ralph Fiennes, F. Murray Abraham, Mathieu Amalric, Adrien Brody
180.plot: The adventures of Gustave H, a legendary concierge at a famous hotel from the fictional Republic of Zubrowka between the first and second World Wars, and Zero Moustafa, the lobby boy who becomes his most trusted friend.

181.title: Au nom du père et du fils
181.actors: Yves Soutière, Pierre Chagnon, Nathalie Coupal, Vincent Bilodeau
181.plot: L'histoire s'étend sur 37 ans, de 1884 à 1921, et raconte la naissance d'un village des Hautes Laurentides, Saint-Bernard, né du projet de colonisation du curé Labelle. L'histoire gravite ...

182.title: Million Dollar Baby
182.actors: Clint Eastwood, Hilary Swank, Morgan Freeman, Jay Baruchel
182.plot: A determined woman works with a hardened boxing trainer to become a professional.

183.title: Ben-Hur
183.actors: Charlton Heston, Jack Hawkins, Haya Harareet, Stephen Boyd
183.plot: When a Jewish prince is betrayed and sent into slavery by a Roman friend, he regains his freedom and comes back for revenge.

184.title: The Grapes of Wrath
184.actors: Henry Fonda, Jane Darwell, John Carradine, Charley Grapewin
184.plot: A poor Midwest family is forced off their land. They travel to California, suffering the misfortunes of the homeless in the Great Depression.

185.title: Hachi: A Dog's Tale
185.actors: Richard Gere, Joan Allen, Cary-Hiroyuki Tagawa, Sarah Roemer
185.plot: A college professor bonds with an abandoned dog he takes into his home.

186.title: Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind
186.actors: Sumi Shimamoto, Mahito Tsujimura, Hisako Kyôda, Gorô Naya
186.plot: Warrior and pacifist Princess Nausicaä desperately struggles to prevent two warring nations from destroying themselves and their dying planet.

187.title: Shutter Island
187.actors: Leonardo DiCaprio, Mark Ruffalo, Ben Kingsley, Max von Sydow
187.plot: In 1954, a U.S. Marshal investigates the disappearance of a murderer who escaped from a hospital for the criminally insane.

188.title: Diabolique
188.actors: Simone Signoret, Véra Clouzot, Paul Meurisse, Charles Vanel
188.plot: The wife and mistress of a loathed school principal hatch a plan to murder him while having the perfect alibi. They carry out the plan...but then his body disappears.

189.title: Sin City
189.actors: Jessica Alba, Devon Aoki, Alexis Bledel, Powers Boothe
189.plot: A film that explores the dark and miserable town, Basin City, and tells the story of three different people, all caught up in violent corruption.

190.title: The Wizard of Oz
190.actors: Judy Garland, Frank Morgan, Ray Bolger, Bert Lahr
190.plot: Dorothy Gale is swept away from a farm in Kansas to a magical land of Oz in a tornado and embarks on a quest with her new friends to see the Wizard who can help her return home to Kansas and help her friends as well.

191.title: Gandhi
191.actors: Ben Kingsley, Rohini Hattangadi, Roshan Seth, Candice Bergen
191.plot: Mohandas K. Gandhi's character is fully explained as a man of nonviolence. Through his patience, he is able to drive the British out of the subcontinent. And the stubborn nature of Jinnah and his commitment towards Pakistan is portrayed.

192.title: The Bourne Ultimatum
192.actors: Matt Damon, Julia Stiles, David Strathairn, Scott Glenn
192.plot: Jason Bourne dodges a ruthless C.I.A. official and his Agents from a new assassination program while searching for the origins of his life as a trained killer.

193.title: Stalker
193.actors: Alisa Freyndlikh, Aleksandr Kaydanovskiy, Anatoliy Solonitsyn, Nikolay Grinko
193.plot: A guide leads two men through an area known as the Zone to find a room that grants wishes.

194.title: The Best Years of Our Lives
194.actors: Myrna Loy, Fredric March, Dana Andrews, Teresa Wright
194.plot: Three World War II veterans return home to small-town America to discover that they and their families have been irreparably changed.

195.title: Donnie Darko
195.actors: Jake Gyllenhaal, Holmes Osborne, Maggie Gyllenhaal, Daveigh Chase
195.plot: A troubled teenager is plagued by visions of a man in a large rabbit suit who manipulates him to commit a series of crimes, after he narrowly escapes a bizarre accident.

196.title: Strangers on a Train
196.actors: Farley Granger, Ruth Roman, Robert Walker, Leo G. Carroll
196.plot: A psychopath forces a tennis star to comply with his theory that two strangers can get away with murder.

197.title: Jurassic Park
197.actors: Sam Neill, Laura Dern, Jeff Goldblum, Richard Attenborough
197.plot: A pragmatic Paleontologist visiting an almost complete theme park is tasked with protecting a couple of kids after a power failure causes the park's cloned dinosaurs to run loose.

198.title: 8½
198.actors: Marcello Mastroianni, Claudia Cardinale, Anouk Aimée, Sandra Milo
198.plot: A harried movie director retreats into his memories and fantasies.

199.title: The Avengers
199.actors: Robert Downey Jr., Chris Evans, Mark Ruffalo, Chris Hemsworth
199.plot: Earth's mightiest heroes must come together and learn to fight as a team if they are going to stop the mischievous Loki and his alien army from enslaving humanity.

200.title: Before Sunrise
200.actors: Ethan Hawke, Julie Delpy, Andrea Eckert, Hanno Pöschl
200.plot: A young man and woman meet on a train in Europe, and wind up spending one evening together in Vienna. Unfortunately, both know that this will probably be their only night together.

201.title: The Hamster Factor and Other Tales of Twelve Monkeys
201.actors: Keith Fulton, Terry Gilliam, Charles Roven, Lloyd Phillips
201.plot: A documentary following Terry Gilliam through the creation of "12 Monkeys" (1995)

202.title: The Terminator
202.actors: Arnold Schwarzenegger, Michael Biehn, Linda Hamilton, Paul Winfield
202.plot: In 1984, a human soldier is tasked to stop an indestructible cyborg killing machine, both sent from 2029, from executing a young woman, whose unborn son is the key to humanity's future salvation.

203.title: Infernal Affairs
203.actors: Andy Lau, Tony Chiu-Wai Leung, Anthony Chau-Sang Wong, Eric Tsang
203.plot: A story between a mole in the police department and an undercover cop. Their objectives are the same: to find out who is the mole, and who is the cop.

204.title: Jaws
204.actors: Roy Scheider, Robert Shaw, Richard Dreyfuss, Lorraine Gary
204.plot: When a killer shark unleashes chaos on a beach community, it's up to a local sheriff, a marine biologist, and an old seafarer to hunt the beast down.

205.title: Groundhog Day
205.actors: Bill Murray, Andie MacDowell, Chris Elliott, Stephen Tobolowsky
205.plot: A weatherman finds himself inexplicably living the same day over and over again.

206.title: Memories of Murder
206.actors: Kang-ho Song, Sang-kyung Kim, Roe-ha Kim, Jae-ho Song
206.plot: In a small Korean province in 1986, two detectives struggle with the case of multiple young women being found raped and murdered by an unknown culprit.

207.title: Monsters, Inc.
207.actors: John Goodman, Billy Crystal, Mary Gibbs, Steve Buscemi
207.plot: In order to power the city, monsters have to scare children so that they scream. However, the children are toxic to the monsters, and after a child gets through, 2 monsters realize things may not be what they think.

208.title: The Battle of Algiers
208.actors: Brahim Hadjadj, Jean Martin, Yacef Saadi, Samia Kerbash
208.plot: In the 1950s, fear and violence escalate as the people of Algiers fight for independence from the French government.

209.title: Guardians of the Galaxy
209.actors: Chris Pratt, Zoe Saldana, Dave Bautista, Vin Diesel
209.plot: A group of intergalactic criminals must pull together to stop a fanatical warrior with plans to purge the universe.

210.title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
210.actors: Ralph Fiennes, Michael Gambon, Alan Rickman, Daniel Radcliffe
210.plot: Harry (Daniel Radcliffe), Ron (Rupert Grint), and Hermione (Emma Watson) search for Voldemort's (Ralph Fiennes') remaining Horcruxes in their effort to destroy the Dark Lord as the final battle rages on at Hogwarts.

211.title: The Truman Show
211.actors: Jim Carrey, Laura Linney, Noah Emmerich, Natascha McElhone
211.plot: An insurance salesman discovers his whole life is actually a reality TV show.

212.title: Throne of Blood
212.actors: Toshirô Mifune, Isuzu Yamada, Takashi Shimura, Akira Kubo
212.plot: A war-hardened general, egged on by his ambitious wife, works to fulfill a prophecy that he would become lord of Spider's Web Castle.

213.title: Fanny and Alexander
213.actors: Kristina Adolphson, Börje Ahlstedt, Pernilla Allwin, Kristian Almgren
213.plot: Two young Swedish children experience the many comedies and tragedies of their family, the Ekdahls.

214.title: Rocky
214.actors: Sylvester Stallone, Talia Shire, Burt Young, Carl Weathers
214.plot: A small-time boxer gets a supremely rare chance to fight a heavy-weight champion in a bout in which he strives to go the distance for his self-respect.

215.title: Barry Lyndon
215.actors: Ryan O'Neal, Marisa Berenson, Patrick Magee, Hardy Krüger
215.plot: An Irish rogue wins the heart of a rich widow and assumes her dead husband's aristocratic position in 18th-century England.

216.title: Dog Day Afternoon
216.actors: Penelope Allen, Sully Boyar, John Cazale, Beulah Garrick
216.plot: A man robs a bank to pay for his lover's operation, which turns into a hostage situation and a media circus.

217.title: The Imitation Game
217.actors: Benedict Cumberbatch, Keira Knightley, Matthew Goode, Rory Kinnear
217.plot: During World War II, the English mathematical genius Alan Turing tries to crack the German Enigma code with help from fellow mathematicians.

218.title: Ip Man
218.actors: Donnie Yen, Simon Yam, Lynn Xiong, Hiroyuki Ikeuchi
218.plot: During the Japanese invasion of 1937, when a wealthy martial artist is forced to leave his home and work to support his family, he reluctantly agrees to train others in the art of Wing Chun for self-defense.

219.title: The King's Speech
219.actors: Colin Firth, Helena Bonham Carter, Derek Jacobi, Robert Portal
219.plot: The story of King George VI, his impromptu ascension to the throne of the British Empire in 1936, and the speech therapist who helped the unsure monarch overcome his stammer.

220.title: High Noon
220.actors: Gary Cooper, Thomas Mitchell, Lloyd Bridges, Katy Jurado
220.plot: A town Marshal, despite the disagreements of his newlywed bride and the townspeople around him, must face a gang of deadly killers alone at high noon when the gang leader, an outlaw he sent up years ago, arrives on the noon train.

221.title: La Haine
221.actors: Vincent Cassel, Hubert Koundé, Saïd Taghmaoui, Abdel Ahmed Ghili
221.plot: 24 hours in the lives of three young men in the French suburbs the day after a violent riot.

222.title: A Fistful of Dollars
222.actors: Clint Eastwood, Marianne Koch, Gian Maria Volontè, Wolfgang Lukschy
222.plot: A wandering gunfighter plays two rival families against each other in a town torn apart by greed, pride, and revenge.

223.title: Pirates of the Caribbean: The Curse of the Black Pearl
223.actors: Johnny Depp, Geoffrey Rush, Orlando Bloom, Keira Knightley
223.plot: Blacksmith Will Turner teams up with eccentric pirate "Captain" Jack Sparrow to save his love, the governor's daughter, from Jack's former pirate allies, who are now undead.

224.title: Notorious
224.actors: Cary Grant, Ingrid Bergman, Claude Rains, Louis Calhern
224.plot: A woman is asked to spy on a group of Nazi friends in South America. How far will she have to go to ingratiate herself with them?

225.title: Castle in the Sky
225.actors: Anna Paquin, James Van Der Beek, Cloris Leachman, Mark Hamill
225.plot: A young boy and a girl with a magic crystal must race against pirates and foreign agents in a search for a legendary floating castle.

226.title: Prisoners
226.actors: Hugh Jackman, Jake Gyllenhaal, Viola Davis, Maria Bello
226.plot: When Keller Dover's daughter and her friend go missing, he takes matters into his own hands as the police pursue multiple leads and the pressure mounts.

227.title: The Help
227.actors: Emma Stone, Viola Davis, Bryce Dallas Howard, Octavia Spencer
227.plot: An aspiring author during the civil rights movement of the 1960s decides to write a book detailing the African American maids' point of view on the white families for which they work, and the hardships they go through on a daily basis.

228.title: Roman Holiday
228.actors: Gregory Peck, Audrey Hepburn, Eddie Albert, Hartley Power
228.plot: A bored and sheltered princess escapes her guardians and falls in love with an American newsman in Rome.

229.title: Who's Afraid of Virginia Woolf?
229.actors: Elizabeth Taylor, Richard Burton, George Segal, Sandy Dennis
229.plot: A bitter, aging couple, with the help of alcohol, use their young houseguests to fuel anguish and emotional pain towards each other over the course of a distressing night.

230.title: Spring, Summer, Fall, Winter... and Spring
230.actors: Yeong-su Oh, Ki-duk Kim, Young-min Kim, Jae-kyeong Seo
230.plot: A boy is raised by a Buddhist monk on an isolated floating temple where the years pass like the seasons.

231.title: The Night of the Hunter
231.actors: Robert Mitchum, Shelley Winters, Lillian Gish, James Gleason
231.plot: A religious fanatic marries a gullible widow whose young children are reluctant to tell him where their real daddy hid $10,000 he'd stolen in a robbery.

232.title: Beauty and the Beast
232.actors: Robby Benson, Jesse Corti, Rex Everhart, Angela Lansbury
232.plot: A Prince cursed to spend his days as a hideous monster sets out to regain his humanity by earning a young woman's love.

233.title: Papillon
233.actors: Steve McQueen, Dustin Hoffman, Victor Jory, Don Gordon
233.plot: A man befriends a fellow criminal as the two of them begin serving their sentence on a dreadful prison island, which inspires the man to plot his escape.

234.title: La Strada
234.actors: Anthony Quinn, Giulietta Masina, Richard Basehart, Aldo Silvani
234.plot: A care-free girl is sold to a traveling entertainer, consequently enduring physical and emotional pain along the way.

235.title: Before Sunset
235.actors: Ethan Hawke, Julie Delpy, Vernon Dobtcheff, Louise Lemoine Torrès
235.plot: Nine years after Jesse and Celine first met, they encounter each other again on the French leg of Jesse's book tour.

236.title: Anatomy of a Murder
236.actors: James Stewart, Lee Remick, Ben Gazzara, Arthur O'Connell
236.plot: In a murder trial, the defendant says he suffered temporary insanity after the victim raped his wife. What is the truth, and will he win his case?

237.title: X-Men: Days of Future Past
237.actors: Hugh Jackman, James McAvoy, Michael Fassbender, Jennifer Lawrence
237.plot: The X-Men send Wolverine to the past in a desperate effort to change history and prevent an event that results in doom for both humans and mutants.

238.title: The Hustler
238.actors: Paul Newman, Jackie Gleason, Piper Laurie, George C. Scott
238.plot: An up-and-coming pool player plays a long-time champion in a single high-stakes match.

239.title: The Graduate
239.actors: Anne Bancroft, Dustin Hoffman, Katharine Ross, William Daniels
239.plot: A disillusioned college graduate finds himself torn between his older lover and her daughter.

240.title: Gangs of Wasseypur
240.actors: Manoj Bajpayee, Richa Chadha, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tigmanshu Dhulia
240.plot: A clash between Sultan and Shahid Khan leads to the expulsion of Khan from Wasseypur, and ignites a deadly blood feud spanning three generations.

241.title: Elite Squad: The Enemy Within
241.actors: Wagner Moura, Irandhir Santos, André Ramiro, Milhem Cortaz
241.plot: After a prison riot, former-Captain Nascimento, now a high ranking security officer in Rio de Janeiro, is swept into a bloody political dispute that involves government officials and paramilitary groups.

242.title: The Big Sleep
242.actors: Humphrey Bogart, Lauren Bacall, John Ridgely, Martha Vickers
242.plot: Private detective Philip Marlowe is hired by a rich family. Before the complex case is over, he's seen murder, blackmail, and what might be love.

243.title: Akira
243.actors: Mitsuo Iwata, Nozomu Sasaki, Mami Koyama, Tesshô Genda
243.plot: A secret military project endangers Neo-Tokyo when it turns a biker gang member into a rampaging psychic psychopath who can only be stopped by two teenagers and a group of psychics.

244.title: Departures
244.actors: Masahiro Motoki, Tsutomu Yamazaki, Ryôko Hirosue, Kazuko Yoshiyuki
244.plot: A newly unemployed cellist takes a job preparing the dead for funerals.

245.title: Paris, Texas
245.actors: Harry Dean Stanton, Nastassja Kinski, Dean Stockwell, Aurore Clément
245.plot: Travis Henderson, an aimless drifter who has been missing for four years, wanders out of the desert and must reconnect with society, himself, his life, and his family.

246.title: Laura
246.actors: Gene Tierney, Dana Andrews, Clifton Webb, Vincent Price
246.plot: A Police detective falls in love with the woman whose murder he is investigating.
